FuncDef:
The router-id-extend private enable command configures a device to add the router ID that is a private extended community attribute to locally generated EVPN routes.
The undo router-id-extend private enable command disables a device from adding the router ID attribute to locally generated EVPN routes. The router-id-extend private enable command configures a device to add the router ID that is a private extended community attribute to locally generated EVPN routes. The undo router-id-extend private enable command disables a device from adding the router ID attribute to locally generated EVPN routes. By default, a device does not add the router ID to EVPN routes when the EVPN routes are generated locally. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
